content.description: Data was collected from a simple random sample of 200 cell phone users age 18 or older in the United States. Each user was categorized by age-group and by whether he or she uses a certain cell phone app. The table shown summarizes the data, with expected cell counts in parentheses.
content.question: Uses Cell Phone App Yes No Total Age-Group Young Adults 4 (15.2) 76 (64.8) 80 Older Adults 29 (19.38) 73 (82.62) 102 Elderly Adults 5 (3.42) 13 (14.58) 18 Total 38 162 200 Which statement is true about whether the conditions for a chi-square test for independence have been met?

choices.label: All necessary conditions are satisfied to apply a chi-square test for independence between age-group and texting use by cell phone users.
The data from the different age-groups are not the result of independent random samples; therefore, the conditions for the test are not met.
The total sample size in one or more of the age-groups is too small to meet the conditions of the chi-square test for independence.
Not all of the observed cell counts are large enough to satisfy the conditions for the chi-square test for independence.
Not all of the expected cell counts are large enough to satisfy the conditions for the chi-square test for independence.

content.answer: Not all of the expected cell counts are large enough to satisfy the conditions for the chi-square test for independence.
